questions.question: What is the purpose of the TCP Protocol's Sequence Number field?
content: To identify the specific TCP port number
To indicate the acknowledgment number of the last segment received
To keep track of the number of transmitted bits
To specify the sequence number of the first data byte in the segment

content: Controls user access to the virtual machines
Encrypts data transmissions between virtual machines
Installs software updates on virtual machines
